H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H7257.def: = action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2397.def: = small, curved piece of metal or bone or even a strong thorn, with a sharp point on one end, usually with a barb just behind the point, and a loop or bend on the other end to which a line can be attached; ► used to catch and control animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H3895.def: = the lower bony structure of the skull of humans and certain animals that forms the framework of the mouth and holds the teeth

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H1710.def: = collective designation of various cold-blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H7193.def: = small overlapping plates covering the body of a fish

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H402.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H4938.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler, shepherd, or prophet; gives support to the sick and elderly; ≈ associated with authority and support

H7070.def: = a tall grass with stiff, sharply-pointed leaves and a plume-like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof-coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H7533.def: = causative action by which humans destroy an object by using force to break it into two or more pieces

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H3802.def: = the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position
